Introduction

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd

When creating R markdown websites, I often find myself wanting to organise content into a nice-looking grid of links. For example, in a recent project I wanted something like this:

Starting R markdown

An introduction to R markdown. The target audience is a novice R user with no previous experience with markdown.

Starting ggplot2

An introduction to ggplot2. The target audience is a novice user with no previous experience with R or ggplot2.

Starting programming

This is primarily a tutorial on making generative art in R, but in doing so introduces core programming constructs and data structures. It is assumed the user has some previous experience with ggplot2.

The goal of bs4cards is to his task a little easier inside an R markdown document or website.

Enabling bootstrap 4

The first step in using the package is to make sure that your R markdown document uses version 4 of bootstrap: the bs4cards package takes its name from the “cards” system introduced in bootstrap version 4, and will not work properly if used in R markdown documents that rely on bootstrap version 3. To ensure that you are using bootstrap 4, you need to edit the YAML header for your document to specify which version of bootstrap you want to use. For example, here is the relevant section of YAML you might use in a simple R markdown site

output:
  html_document:
    theme:
      version: 4

This overrides the R markdown defaults to ensure that the output is built using bootstrap 4.5. To enable bootstrap 4 in a pkgdown site such as this one, edit the _pkgdown.yml file to include the following

template:
  bootstrap: 4

You may need to update to the development version of pkgdown to make this work.

Building bootstrap cards

The main function in bs4cards is the card() function. To create a minimal text-only card, call the card() function specifying the title and text arguments:

library(bs4cards)

card(
  title = "A bootstrap card", 
  text = "This is a minimal bootstrap 4 card containing title and text"
)
A bootstrap card

This is a minimal bootstrap 4 card containing title and text

In most cases you’ll also want to add an image to the card using the image argument. This argument specifies the path to the image file. For the purposes of this example I’ll set image paths using links to placekitten.com:

card(
  title = "A kitten card",
  image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",
  text = "The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute"
)
A kitten card

The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute

Images are placed at the top of the card by default, but can be moved to the bottom by setting image_align = "bottom":

card(
  title = "A kitten card",
  image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",
  text = "The image at the bottom of this card is from placekitten.com. It's still cute",
  image_align = "bottom"
)
A kitten card

The image at the bottom of this card is from placekitten.com. It's still cute

In most cases you’ll want cards to be associated with a link, which is set by specifying the link argument to card(). This will convert both the card title and image to links:

card(
  title = "Placekittens",
  image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",
  text = "The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute",
  link = "https://placekitten.com"
)
Placekittens

The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute

Building card groups

Cards are usually arranged into groups rather than presented in isolation. The card_group() function takes a list of cards as input and generates a bootstrap card group. To illustrate how this works, I’ll use the sample_card() function that generates a random card

sample_card()
A kitten card

Haec para/doca illi, nos admirabilia dicamus. Quicquid enim a sapientia proficiscitur, id continuo debet expletum esse omnibus suis partibus; Quam ob rem tandem, inquit, non satisfacit?

and use this to create a list of eight cards:

kitty_list <- list(
  sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card(),
  sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card()
)

This list is then passed to card_group():

card_group(kitty_list)
A kitten card

Sic igitur in homine perfectio ista in eo potissimum, quod est optimum, id est in virtute, laudatur. Et nemo nimium beatus est; Ita ne hoc quidem modo paria peccata sunt. Quasi vero, inquit, perpetua oratio rhetorum solum, non etiam philosophorum sit.

A kitten card

Gracchum patrem non beatiorem fuisse quam fillum, cum alter stabilire rem publicam studuerit, alter evertere. Omnia contraria, quos etiam insanos esse vultis. Facillimum id quidem est, inquam. Paria sunt igitur.

A kitten card

Nam cui proposito sit conservatio sui, necesse est huic partes quoque sui caras suo genere laudabiles. Dolere malum est: in crucem qui agitur, beatus esse non potest. Et quod est munus, quod opus sapientiae?

A kitten card

Ita ne hoc quidem modo paria peccata sunt. Quae fere omnia appellantur uno ingenii nomine, easque virtutes qui habent, ingeniosi vocantur. Omnia contraria, quos etiam insanos esse vultis.

A kitten card

Nam cui proposito sit conservatio sui, necesse est huic partes quoque sui caras suo genere laudabiles. Omnia contraria, quos etiam insanos esse vultis. Eadem nunc mea adversum te oratio est.

A kitten card

Et certamen honestum et disputatio splendida! Dempta enim aeternitate nihilo beatior Iuppiter quam Epicurus; Et quod est munus, quod opus sapientiae?

A kitten card

Eiuro, inquit adridens, iniquum, hac quidem de re; Apparet statim, quae sint officia, quae actiones. An me, inquam, nisi te audire vellem, censes haec dicturum fuisse? Si quicquam extra virtutem habeatur in bonis.

A kitten card

Ut non sine causa ex iis memoriae ducta sit disciplina. Quae fere omnia appellantur uno ingenii nomine, easque virtutes qui habent, ingeniosi vocantur. Nosti, credo, illud: Nemo pius est, qui pietatem-;

When placed in a group, cards are arranged into a responsive grid. The images in each card retain their original aspect ratio, but the size of the card is stretched vertically to ensure that all cards within any row have the same height.

Adding headers and footers

The card() function includes header and footer arguments that can be used to add headers and footers to a bootstrap card, as illustrated below:

card(
  title = "A kitten card",
  image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",
  text = "The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute",
  header = "Header",
  footer = "Footer"
)
Header
A kitten card

The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute

Footer

When arranged into a card group, headers and footers line up with one another:

kitties_with_footers <- list(
  sample_card(footer = "Kitten A"), 
  sample_card(footer = "Kitten B"), 
  sample_card(footer = "Kitten C")
) 

card_group(kitties_with_footers)
A kitten card

Quam ob rem tandem, inquit, non satisfacit? Sed emolumenta communia esse dicuntur, recte autem facta et peccata non habentur communia. Dolere malum est: in crucem qui agitur, beatus esse non potest.

Kitten A
A kitten card

Satis est tibi in te, satis in legibus, satis in mediocribus amicitiis praesidii. Sed ea mala virtuti magnitudine obruebantur. Quid est, quod ab ea absolvi et perfici debeat?

Kitten B
A kitten card

Omnis est enim de virtutis dignitate contentio. Scaevola tribunus plebis ferret ad plebem vellentne de ea re quaeri. Eaedem res maneant alio modo.

Kitten C
kitties_with_headers <- list(
  sample_card(header = "Kitten A"), 
  sample_card(header = "Kitten B"), 
  sample_card(header = "Kitten C")
)

card_group(kitties_with_headers)
Kitten A
A kitten card

Facile pateremur, qui etiam nunc agendi aliquid discendique causa prope contra naturam vígillas suscipere soleamus. Scaevola tribunus plebis ferret ad plebem vellentne de ea re quaeri. Longum est enim ad omnia respondere, quae a te dicta sunt.

Kitten B
A kitten card

Quae fere omnia appellantur uno ingenii nomine, easque virtutes qui habent, ingeniosi vocantur. Contemnit enim disserendi elegantiam, confuse loquitur. Tria genera bonorum; At quicum ioca seria, ut dicitur, quicum arcana, quicum occulta omnia?

Kitten C
A kitten card

Praeclare enim Plato: Beatum, cui etiam in senectute contigerit, ut sapientiam verasque opiniones assequi possit. Et nemo nimium beatus est; Ita ne hoc quidem modo paria peccata sunt. Sed ea mala virtuti magnitudine obruebantur.

Customising card width

card(
  title = "My First Card",
  image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",
  text = "The image above is from placekitten.com. It is extremely cute.",
  width = bs_col(medium = 4) 
)
My First Card

The image above is from placekitten.com. It is extremely cute.

card( title = "My First Card", image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200", text = "The image above is from placekitten.com. It is extremely cute.", width = bs_col(medium = 6) )
My First Card

The image above is from placekitten.com. It is extremely cute.

card( title = "My First Card", image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200", text = "The image above is from placekitten.com. It is extremely cute.", width = bs_col(large = 6) )
My First Card

The image above is from placekitten.com. It is extremely cute.
